revisions.rev:
{{BLP sources|date=May 2010}} {{Infobox person | Name = Larisa Oleynik | image = | imagesize = | caption = Larisa Oleynik playing Bianca Stratford in [[10 Things I Hate About You]] | birth_name = Larisa Romanovna Oleynik | birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1981|6|7}} | birth_place = [[Santa Clara County, California]], U.S. | occupation = Actress | yearsactive = 1993âpresent }} '''Larisa Romanovna Oleynik''' ({{IPA-en|lÉËrÉªsÉ ÉµËleÉªnÉ¨k|pron}} born June 7, 1981) is an American [[actress]]. She came to fame in the mid-1990s, after starring in the title role of the popular television series, ''[[The Secret World of Alex Mack]]'', and has also appeared in theatrical films, including ''[[The Baby-Sitters Club (film)|The Baby-Sitters Club]]'' and ''[[10 Things I Hate About You]]''. Throughout the 2000s, she has mostly appeared in lower-budget films.{{cite news|title= Larisa Oleynik finds the secret is to have fun as 'Alex Mack' |publisher= LA Times|date=October 2, 1994|url= http://articles.latimes.com/1994-10-02/news/tv-45351_1_alex-mack|accessdate=2010-08-24 | first=N.F. | last=Mendoza}} During her period as a teen idol, Oleynik was described as "one of America's favorite 15-year-olds"{{cite web|title=Larisa Online|work=Larisa Oleynik just wants to have fun|url=http://freespace.virgin.net/martin.rolph/articles/Article17.htm|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20070227140200/http://freespace.virgin.net/martin.rolph/articles/Article17.htm|archivedate=2007-02-27|accessdate=April 14, 2006}} and "the proverbial girl next door".{{cite web|title=Larisa Online|work=Her Typical Teen Aura (Published in USA Today on August 4, 1995)|author=Jefferson Graham| url=http://freespace.virgin.net/martin.rolph/articles/Article2.htm| archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20050311220733/http://freespace.virgin.net/martin.rolph/articles/Article2.htm| archivedate=2005-03-11|accessdate=April 14, 2006}}{{cite news|title= Rockin' Role|work= Sun Sentinel|date=|url= http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/1999-05-25/lifestyle/9905240477_1_alex-mack-3rd-rock-alissa|accessdate=2010-11-09}} ==Personal life== Oleynik was born in [[Santa Clara County, California]]. Her mother, Lorraine ([[married and maiden names|nÃ©e]] Allen), is a former [[nurse]], and her father, Roman Oleynik, is an [[anesthesiologist]].{{cite web|url=http://www.filmreference.com/film/31/Larisa-Oleynik.html |title=Larisa Oleynik Biography (1981-) |publisher=Filmreference.com |date= |accessdate=2010-03-08}} Her father's family is [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]]{{cite web | title=Larisa Online | work=PEOPLE Online Hosts Larisa Oleynik--May 29, 1997 | url=http://freespace.virgin.net/martin.rolph/articles/Chat1.htm | archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20020323013256/http://freespace.virgin.net/martin.rolph/articles/Chat1.htm | archivedate=2002-03-23 | accessdate=April 14, 2006 }} and she was raised in the [[Russian Orthodox]] religion.{{cite web | title=Larisa Oline | work=LARISA OLEYNIK; NOVEMBER 13, 1998 | url=http://www.larisa.com/attic/cs/lochat19981113.htm | accessdate=April 14, 2006 }} Oleynik grew up in the [[San Francisco Bay Area]] and began acting in a regional production of ''[[Les MisÃ©rables (musical)|Les MisÃ©rables]]'', after seeing an audition ad in a newspaper when she was eight years old. After appearing in the musical, she contacted an agent and began taking acting lessons. But despite the success in her role as Alex Mack, Oleynik decided to attend college.[http://web.archive.org/web/20070323021000/http://www.themovieinsider.com/celebrities/cid/140/Larisa_Oleynik Larisa Oleynik Celebrity Interview for Bringing Rain (2003) at The Movie Insider] Oleynik attended [[Pinewood School, Los Altos|Pinewood School]] and later [[Sarah Lawrence College]], describing the latter as "the best decision Iâve made",{{cite web|title=Celebrity Spotlight: Larisa Oleynik|work=Girls' Life Magazine|last=Davis|first=Jasmen|url=http://www.girlslife.com/aug04/celebspotlightlarisa.php|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20060424073007/http://www.girlslife.com/aug04/celebspotlightlarisa.php|archivedate=2006-04-24|accessdate=April 14, 2006}} and graduated in 2004. ==Career== Oleynik began her screen acting career at age 12, in a 1993 episode of the television series ''[[Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman]]''; the same year, she also appeared in the made-for-television film, ''River of Rage: The Taking of Maggie Keene'' and was subsequently cast in the lead role of the series ''[[The Secret World of Alex Mack]]'', playing a teenage girl who receives [[telekinetic]] powers as the result of an accident. The series ran on [[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] from 1994 to 1998 and was one of the network's top three most watched shows, becoming a favorite among teen audiences and turning Oleynik into a teen idol. Oleynik reprised the role in an ''[[All That]]'' sketch, although the name was changed to "Alex Sax." Oleynik later appeared in the 100th episode of ''All That''. She made a cameo on ''[[The Adventures of Pete & Pete]]'' during this time, being a nurse at the beginning of the episode ''Dance Fever''.{{cite web|title=Larisa Online| work=Big Mack Attack|author=Judith Maitland|url=http://freespace.virgin.net/martin.rolph/articles/Article5.htm|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20050311222117/http://freespace.virgin.net/martin.rolph/articles/Article5.htm|archivedate=2005-03-11| accessdate=April 14, 2006}} Also, during ''The Secret World of Alex Mack'''s run, she played one of the lead characters in the 1995 feature film ''[[The Baby-Sitters Club (film)|The Baby-Sitters Club]]'' (opposite [[Rachael Leigh Cook]] and [[Schuyler Fisk]]), appeared in several episodes of ''[[Boy Meets World]]'', wrote an advice column for ''[[Tiger Beat]]'' magazine, and was involved in ''Nickelodeon's Big Help'' charity, ''Hands Across Communication'', ''[[Surfrider Foundation]]'' and the ''Starlight Foundation''. She has commented that she stayed "grounded" during her period as a teen star, mainly through the help of a "strong network of people" that she is close to.{{cite web | title=Larisa Online | work=A World Of Her Own (Published in TV Guide in October 1996)| author=By Vicki Jo Radovsky | url=http://freespace.virgin.net/martin.rolph/articles/Article3.htm | archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20050311221340/http://freespace.virgin.net/martin.rolph/articles/Article3.htm | archivedate=2005-03-11 | accessdate=April 14, 2006}} After ''The Secret World of Alex Mack'' ended its run, Oleynik had a starring role in the film ''[[10 Things I Hate About You]]'', a teen comedy where she played a love interest of Gordon-Levitt's character. (She also played the girlfriend of Gordon-Levitt's character in ''[[3rd Rock From the Sun]]''.) The film was released in April 1999 and did fairly well at the box office, grossing a total of $38 million domestically.{{cite web | title=The Numbers.com | work=10 Things I Hate about You | url=http://www.the-numbers.com/movies/1999/10HAT.html | archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20060508171333/http://www.the-numbers.com/movies/1999/10HAT.html | archivedate=2006-05-08 | accessdate=April 14, 2006}} In 1999â2000, Oleynik appeared in twenty one episodes of the [[NBC]] series ''[[3rd Rock from the Sun]]'' (alongside Gordon-Levitt). The same year, she appeared in two [[independent film]]s: ''[[100 Girls]]'' (opposite [[Emmanuelle Chriqui]], [[Katherine Heigl]] and [[Jonathan Tucker]]) and ''A Time for Dancing'' (opposite [[Shiri Appleby]]); neither film received a theatrical release in the United States. She has appeared in ''[[Malcolm in the Middle]]'' as [[Reese Wilkerson|Reese's]] lesbian army buddy, who developed a crush on his mom, [[Lois Wilkerson|Lois]]. Next, Oleynik had a supporting role in the film ''[[An American Rhapsody]]'', which received a limited release in August 2001, and appeared in ''Bringing Rain'', a low-budget film. Oleynik was cast in a supporting role in the series ''[[Pepper Dennis]]'', which began airing on [[The WB]] in April 2006, but was not picked up by The WB's successor, [[The CW Television Network|The CW]]. In March 2008, Oleynik guest-starred in episode 13 of ''[[Aliens in America]]''. In March 2011, Oleynik started appearing in a recurring role on ''[[Hawaii Five-0]]'' as [[Central Intelligence Agency|CIA]] analyst Jenna Kaye. Her character is later killed off. {{cite web | name="cbs.com" | title=Hawaii Five-0 Adds Cast Member | url=http://www.cbs.com/forum/posts/list/143747.page |accessdate=January 20, 2011}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable" |+Film |- ! Episode: "Curtis Wilson's a Total Nut Job: Film at 11" |- |2008 |''[[Aliens in America]]'' |Zoe |Episode: "Community Theater" |- |2008 |''[[Together Again for the First Time]]'' |Brenda |Video |- |2009 |''[[Psych]]'' |Willow Gimbley |Episode: "Let's Get Hairy" |- |2009 |''[[Without a Trace]]'' |Liza Miller |Episode: "Voir Dire" |- |2010 |''Backyard Wedding'' |Renee |TV movie |- |2010 |''[[Mad Men]]'' |Cynthia Baxter |Episode: "[[Chinese Wall (Mad Men)|Chinese Wall]]" |- |2011 |''[[Hawaii Five-0]]'' |Jenna Kaye |4+ episodes |- |2011 |''[[Winx Club]]'' |Icy |Voice Actress |} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Wikiquote}} * {{IMDB name|646351}} * {{tcmdb name|id=144487}} {{Persondata | NAME =Oleynik, Larisa | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH =June 7, 1981 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Santa Clara County, California]], U.S. | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Oleynik, Larisa}} [[Category:American child actors]] [[Category:Eastern Orthodox Christians from the United States]] [[Category:American film actors]] [[Category:American television actors]] [[Category:Actors from California]] [[Category:People from Santa Clara County, California]] [[Category:American people of Ukrainian descent]] [[Category:American people of Russian descent]] [[Category:Russian Orthodox Christians]] [[Category:Sarah Lawrence College alumni]] [[Category:1981 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[cy:Larisa Oleynik]] [[de:Larisa Oleynik]] [[es:Larisa Oleynik]] [[fr:Larisa Oleynik]] [[hr:Larisa Oleynik]] [[is:Larisa Oleynik]] [[it:Larisa Oleynik]] [[nl:Larisa Oleynik]] [[pt:Larisa Oleynik]] [[ru:ÐÐ»ÐµÐ¹Ð½Ð¸Ðº, ÐÐ°ÑÐ¸ÑÐ° Ð Ð¾Ð¼Ð°Ð½Ð¾Ð²Ð½Ð°]] [[fi:Larisa Oleynik]] [[sv:Larisa Oleynik]] [[uk:ÐÐ»ÑÐ¹Ð½Ð¸Ðº ÐÐ°ÑÐ¸ÑÐ° Ð Ð¾Ð¼Ð°Ð½ÑÐ²Ð½Ð°]]
